alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:21PM EST until December 20 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Warner River At Davisville affecting Merrimack County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Warner River at Davisville. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Properties along Tom`s Pond including Pine Lane in Warner are flooded with water overtopping retention walls. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 8.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
